verbose_text: The stronger effect of cinnamaldehyde was later confirmed by Bevilacqua et al., who combined cinnamaldehyde and eugenol to inhibit and/or control the germination of a cocktail of A. acidoterrestris strains and found that 160 ppm of eugenol prolonged the lag phase of the microbial target by 1.5 days, whereas this parameter increased by 4-4.5 days with 80 ppm of cinnamaldehyde added.
